content:
• Thursday, July 21, 2011
  • CYMI

    More on Cymer (NASDAQ:CYMI): in spite of a solid Q2, investors lean hard into the shares in...

    More on Cymer (NASDAQ:CYMI): in spite of a solid Q2, investors lean hard into the shares in after-hours trading, briefly halting the stock after the company warns of significantly lower shipments next quarter as chipmakers review their capital investments. Shares -11.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • CYMI

    Cymer (NASDAQ:CYMI): Q2 EPS of $0.89 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $158.2M (+20% Y/Y). Guides Q3...

    Cymer (NASDAQ:CYMI): Q2 EPS of $0.89 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $158.2M (+20% Y/Y). Guides Q3 sales lower. Shares -11.5% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • NCR

    More on NCR: Q2 easily beats estimates with across-the-board revenue growth. Currency exchange...

    More on NCR: Q2 easily beats estimates with across-the-board revenue growth. Currency exchange was favorable as forex contributed solidly to performance in all units. Entertainment group revenues jumped +85% Y/Y, just days after the company announced it's considering selling it. Shares +4.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ3 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $356.1M (+29% Y/Y) beats by...

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS): FQ3 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $356.1M (+29% Y/Y) beats by $10.8M. Guides for FQ4 revenue of $400M and non-GAAP EPS of $0.53, ahead of $369.2M and $0.50 consensus. Shares +7.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • WDC

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC): FQ4 EPS of $0.81 vs. consensus of $0.66. Revenue of $2.4B (+0.8%...

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC): FQ4 EPS of $0.81 vs. consensus of $0.66. Revenue of $2.4B (+0.8% Y/Y). Shares +0.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • AMD

    More on AMD's Q2: Revenues slightly below $1.58B consensus; 5% Y/Y revenue decline an increase...

    More on AMD's Q2: Revenues slightly below $1.58B consensus; 5% Y/Y revenue decline an increase from Q1's 2% drop; gross margin of 46%, up from 45% in Q1; CPU division revs. flat Y/Y, graphics division down 17%; 10% Q3 rev. growth expected (+/- 2%); implies revenue of $1.73B, ahead of $1.71B consensus. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • WDC

    More on SanDisk (SNDK): Q2 easily beats estimates on soaring flash memory demand. CEO Sanjay...

    More on SanDisk (SNDK): Q2 easily beats estimates on soaring flash memory demand. CEO Sanjay Mehrota says "broad product offerings and diversified channels drove record quarterly revenue, while product cost reductions led to strong profitability." Shares +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • UNP

    Union Pacific's (UNP +4.6%) volume inched up 3% Y/Y in Q2, decelerating from Q1's 5% growth...

    Union Pacific's (UNP +4.6%) volume inched up 3% Y/Y in Q2, decelerating from Q1's 5% growth rate, but CEO Jim Young is upbeat about prospects for a strong second half. Consumers have been "kind of pulling in a bit," causing retailers to keep inventories low and likely delaying the ramp of peak season into August from July. (earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT): FQ4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $17.3B (+8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT): FQ4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $17.3B (+8% Y/Y) beats by $120M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK): Q2 EPS of $1.14 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $1.37B (+17% Y/Y). Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)

    SanDisk (SNDK): Q2 EPS of $1.14 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $1.37B (+17% Y/Y). Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • GOOG

    Quick take on Icahn/Motorola: Even after today's move, Motorola still only has an enterprise...

    Quick take on Icahn/Motorola: Even after today's move, Motorola still only has an enterprise value of about $4.3B; and one has to assume some of that is tied to its cable business, not its phone business. If Motorola's wireless patents can indeed fetch a price similar to Nortel's, the company owes it to shareholders to explore a sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • EGHT

    Internet telecommunications company 8x8 (EGHT -10%) takes a hit after reporting in-line earnings...

    Internet telecommunications company 8x8 (EGHT -10%) takes a hit after reporting in-line earnings for Q1. The company posted record sales and a 91% increase in operating revenues, but investors seemed disappointed with signs of stagnant customer growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • GOOG

    Motorola (MMI +12.4%) is responding to Carl Icahn's call to monetize its patents by suggesting...

    Motorola (MMI +12.4%) is responding to Carl Icahn's call to monetize its patents by suggesting it needs those patents to grow its business. MKM Partners' Tero Kuittinen thinks Motorola's portfolio is equal to Nortel's $4.5B stash, and believes Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) recent win against HTC (OTC:HTCCF) frees Motorola to send its lawyers after Asian rivals.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • ABC

    Amerisource Bergen (ABC -6.5%) shares sink in the wake of Express Scripts (ESRX +5.3%) agreeing...

    Amerisource Bergen (ABC -6.5%) shares sink in the wake of Express Scripts (ESRX +5.3%) agreeing to buy Medco (MHS +14.7%). Medco is ABC's biggest client, representing 18% of company revenues in 2010. While the Medco contract goes through March 2013, its loss could cause a decline of $0.15/share in ABC's EPS, analysts say.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • FNGN

    Shares of Financial Engines (FNGN +5.9%) and Encore Capital Group (ECPG +5.4%) rally strongly...

    Shares of Financial Engines (FNGN +5.9%) and Encore Capital Group (ECPG +5.4%) rally strongly after S&P announces the firms will be added to the S&P 600 SmallCap index after the close of business on July 27.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is now up 4.8% following Intel's (INTC -1%) Q2 results, as the latter's...

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is now up 4.8% following Intel's (INTC -1%) Q2 results, as the latter's PC-related numbers and commentary proved less bearish than expected. By contrast, hard drive giant Western Digital (WDC -8.1%) and solid-state drive vendor OCZ Technology (OCZ -5.2%) are both trading down following Seagate's (STX -16.7%) guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • EMAN

    Virtual imaging designer EMagin (EMAN -22%) remains in the tank after lowering its guidance for...

    Virtual imaging designer EMagin (EMAN -22%) remains in the tank after lowering its guidance for fiscal 2011 yesterday. The company says revenues will be negatively impacted by the delay of two key military contracts into 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • DO

    Shares of Diamond Offshore Drilling (DO -3.9%) falter after the firm just misses Q2 estimates,...

    Shares of Diamond Offshore Drilling (DO -3.9%) falter after the firm just misses Q2 estimates, hitting $1.91 EPS vs. $1.92 consensus. Executives say the firm had more work stoppages this month on its deepwater rigs, but in the past 45 days has also added 10 new agreements worth $1B in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • RHI

    More on Robert Half (RHI +15.6%): Q2 earnings tripled for the second straight quarter on an...

    More on Robert Half (RHI +15.6%): Q2 earnings tripled for the second straight quarter on an increase in permanent placements and technology staffing. The company saw growth in all of its divisions, and continues to benefit from the strength in professional and technical hiring trends.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • RVBD

    After falling yesterday on Riverbed's (RVBD -2.1%) weak results, some high-flying networking and...

    After falling yesterday on Riverbed's (RVBD -2.1%) weak results, some high-flying networking and cloud names are falling today due to F5's (FFIV -10.7%) uninspiring guidance. ARUN -4.7%. CTXS -1.2%. APKT -5.3%. PLCM -6.3%. CRM -3.7%. During its FQ3 CC, F5 reported seeing soft demand in the Americas and EMEA.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • BRK.A

    Shares of select coal companies gain as speculation mounts consolidation could be seen in the...

    Shares of select coal companies gain as speculation mounts consolidation could be seen in the coal industry with Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A +1.5%) a possible suitor. Gainers: Walter Energy (WLT +3.4%), L&L Energy (LLEN +2.9%), Alpha Natural (ANR +2.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • MKSI

    MKS Instruments (MKSI +7.8%) gains after reporting Q2 results post-bell yesterday. The firm...

    MKS Instruments (MKSI +7.8%) gains after reporting Q2 results post-bell yesterday. The firm issued guidance on Q3 sales of $180M-$210M, and EPS $0.40-$0.60 on its view strength in the semiconductor market will offset weakness in the firm's solar business. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • NYT

    New York Times (NYT +2.8%) is showing peers a paywall can pay off even as newspaper circulation...

    New York Times (NYT +2.8%) is showing peers a paywall can pay off even as newspaper circulation dwindles, amassing 224,000 digital-only subscribers since charging digital readers for access in March (earnings). Newspaper stocks rally: GCI +3.6%, MEG +10.9%, MNI +5.1%. Diversified media: DIS +3.5%, NWS +3.2%, CMCSA +2.6%, CBS +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • SIFY

    Sify Technologies (SIFY -8.5%) gets hit by a WSJ article highlighting how the company used gaps...

    Sify Technologies (SIFY -8.5%) gets hit by a WSJ article highlighting how the company used gaps in Nasdaq's reporting requirements to get around disclosing its share count had tripled over the past year, or that its auditor - KPMG - had quit.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • GOOG

    Motorola Mobility (NYSE:MMI) shares leap +19% after Carl Icahn urges the company to "explore...

    Motorola Mobility (NYSE:MMI) shares leap +19% after Carl Icahn urges the company to "explore options" on its patent portfolio, saying there may be "multiple ways" to add shareholder value. Motorola's patent portfolio is substantially larger than Nortel Networks' and includes numerous 4G technology patents with considerable value.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • AAL

    Shares of American Airlines (AMR -7.8%) slide as investors can't shake off yesterday's earnings...

    Shares of American Airlines (AMR -7.8%) slide as investors can't shake off yesterday's earnings loss and enthusiasm over its large plane order fades. Looking to boost revenue, the firm initiated a $20 fare increase yesterday that an industy insider says rivals are matching.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • DIS

    ESPN ratings surged 20% last week after five weeks of double-digit declines, sending Walt Disney...

    ESPN ratings surged 20% last week after five weeks of double-digit declines, sending Walt Disney (DIS +3.8%) shares to the top of the Dow leader board. The success of ESPN's women's World Cup soccer telecasts tells Wall Street that the TV network can counter the possibilities of strikes in professional sports.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALXN

    Shares of Alexion (ALXN +8.7%) pop after issuing upward guidance, and announcing it plans to...

    Shares of Alexion (ALXN +8.7%) pop after issuing upward guidance, and announcing it plans to launch its Soliris treatment for patients with aHUS in Q4. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • PM

    Philip Morris (PM +4.1%) trades up after posting a solid Q2. The company says strong regional...

    Philip Morris (PM +4.1%) trades up after posting a solid Q2. The company says strong regional sales in Asia and Japan, positive currency translation plus higher prices combined to propel a 22% jump in earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • NOK

    In conjunction with its Q2 report, Nokia (NOK +3.1%) has disclosed it received an up-front...

    In conjunction with its Q2 report, Nokia (NOK +3.1%) has disclosed it received an up-front payment of about $600M from Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) as part of their licensing deal, along with ongoing royalty payments. Acquiring InterDigital (IDCC +9.8%), which is locked in a patent dispute with Nokia, could be a way of dealing with those payments.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox Technologies (MLNX +11.8%) soars on volume 3X normal after reporting record results...

    Mellanox Technologies (MLNX +11.8%) soars on volume 3X normal after reporting record results last night. A 59% Y/Y increase in revenue spotlighted the Q2 report. (PR).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • SCHL

    Scholastic (SCHL +9.3%) jumps after Q4 earnings topped estimates across-the-board. Higher...

    Scholastic (SCHL +9.3%) jumps after Q4 earnings topped estimates across-the-board. Higher educational publishing and international revenue helped to offset a decrease in sales from its children's book publishing unit and an overall increase in material costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • CRUS

    More on Cirrus Logic (CRUS -10.7%): FQ1 earnings dropped 48% as costs from an earlier production...

    More on Cirrus Logic (CRUS -10.7%): FQ1 earnings dropped 48% as costs from an earlier production problem cut into margins. The problem remains, and won't likely be resolved until the end of the current quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM

  • Frenzied buying taking place in Europe with an hour to go before the close. Italian shares (EWI)...

    Frenzied buying taking place in Europe with an hour to go before the close. Italian shares (EWI) +4%, a 6% swing from earlier. Spain (EWP) +3.5%, France (EWQ) +2.1%, Stoxx 50 (FEZ) +2.5% after being down 1% earlier. Euro financial etf EUFN +5.4%. FXE +1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • SABA

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA -18%) trades lower after a hard miss on its Q4 earnings. The stock...

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA -18%) trades lower after a hard miss on its Q4 earnings. The stock posted a loss despite record sales for the quarter, as higher investment costs negatively impacted revenues. Benchmark downgrades the stock on the news, reversing course just two days after reiterating a buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • IDCC

    Jeffries thinks InterDigital's (IDCC +10.7%) patent portfolio, which it believes has about 16%...

    Jeffries thinks InterDigital's (IDCC +10.7%) patent portfolio, which it believes has about 16% of "essential" 4G LTE patents, could be worth $3B-$10B to Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), due to iPhone royalty savings. Meanwhile, Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) needs InterDigital's patents to prevent Android royalties from becoming a "burden" to OEMs. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • PURE

    Shares of Pure Bioscience (OTC:PURE +14.5%) pop after the firm announces the EPA approved...

    Shares of Pure Bioscience (OTC:PURE +14.5%) pop after the firm announces the EPA approved amendments to the label of its disinfecting product. The firm can promote the kill time of PURE Hard Surfaces at 30 seconds for pathogens, and can include Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C and multiple Carbapenem-resistant bacteria on the label.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • MVIS

    Shares of Microvision (MVIS +5.8%) soar after the firm reports Q2 results and announces a new...

    Shares of Microvision (MVIS +5.8%) soar after the firm reports Q2 results and announces a new contact with a "major automobile manufacturer" to develop its ultra-miniature laser technology inside a mass-produced car model.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • TEX

    Terex (TEX -6%) trades lower after reporting weaker-than-expected Q2 results yesterday. While...

    Terex (TEX -6%) trades lower after reporting weaker-than-expected Q2 results yesterday. While losses narrowed significantly, its bottom line still suffers from high raw material costs and lingering weakness in construction and industrial markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM

  • MIPS Technologies (MIP +4.8%) jumps on rumors of a takeover.

    MIPS Technologies (MIP +4.8%) jumps on rumors of a takeover.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • NYT

    More on the New York Times' (NYSE:NYT) Q2 results: Revenue missed consensus by $0.7M, and...

    More on the New York Times' (NYSE:NYT) Q2 results: Revenue missed consensus by $0.7M, and digital ad revenue was up only 2.6% Y/Y. However, digital subscriptions grew to 224K, up from 100K in April. In addition, the company has 57K in subscriptions for platforms such as Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Kindle. Shares +6.8%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • VIVO

    More on Meridian Bioscience (VIVO -12%): Despite a double-digit increase in sales, margins fell...

    More on Meridian Bioscience (VIVO -12%): Despite a double-digit increase in sales, margins fell on continued weakness from its European diagnostics and core life science units. On a local currency basis, European diagnostics revenue fell 6%, while core life science declined 12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • MS

    Praises flow for Morgan Stanley's (NYSE:MS) quarter, which saw a lighter-than-expected loss and...

    Praises flow for Morgan Stanley's (NYSE:MS) quarter, which saw a lighter-than-expected loss and gains in all its underlying businesses, particularly underwriting and deal-making. Dick Bove can barely contain his excitement, calling MS "the new Goldman," even though it marks the first time revenues trumped those of Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) since 2008. Shares open +6.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • CAKE

    More on Cheesecake Factory (CAKE -3.5%): Q2 earnings +29% on continued improvement in same-store...

    More on Cheesecake Factory (CAKE -3.5%): Q2 earnings +29% on continued improvement in same-store sales, but revenue came in below expectations as sales growth flattened in June.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • MET

    MetLife (NYSE:MET) plans to sell its banking division according to its CEO, noting MetLife Bank...

    MetLife (NYSE:MET) plans to sell its banking division according to its CEO, noting MetLife Bank only accounted for 2% of the firm's Q1 earnings. Shares +3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • MS

    More on Morgan Stanley (MS +5.9%) earnings: MS took a $1.7B charge for the conversion of...

    More on Morgan Stanley (MS +5.9%) earnings: MS took a $1.7B charge for the conversion of Mitsubishi UFJ Financial’s preferred stake in the bank. Trading revenue rose 14% from Q1, making MS the only major U.S. bank to post an increase. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • ESRX

    Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) is up 9.2% premarket, and Medco (NYSE:MHS) up 20.7%, following...

    Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) is up 9.2% premarket, and Medco (NYSE:MHS) up 20.7%, following their merger announcement. During their CC, the companies express confidence about the deal meeting with regulatory approval. The fact that UnitedHealth (NYSE:UNH) will be abandoning Medco in 2013 could help their cause. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • VIVO

    Meridian Bioscience (NASDAQ:VIVO): Q3 EPS of $0.17 misses by $0.04. Sales of $40.1M (+18% Y/Y)...

    Meridian Bioscience (NASDAQ:VIVO): Q3 EPS of $0.17 misses by $0.04. Sales of $40.1M (+18% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Revises down its fiscal 2011 guidance. (PR). Shares -12.5% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • SWY

    Safeway (NYSE:SWY): Q2 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $10.2B (+7.1% Y/Y). Sees FY'11...

    Safeway (NYSE:SWY): Q2 EPS of $0.41 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $10.2B (+7.1% Y/Y). Sees FY'11 EPS at $1.45-1.65. Shares -2.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS): FQ1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $92.2M (+12.6% Y/Y)....

    Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS): FQ1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $92.2M (+12.6% Y/Y). Sees FQ2 revenues at $101-105M. Shares -9.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • DTLK

    Data center services firm Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK) is up 14.5% premarket after reporting Q2...

    Data center services firm Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK) is up 14.5% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $89.5M (+26% Y/Y) and $0.19, trouncing consensus forecasts of $82.7M and $0.11. The company is also guiding for Q3 revenue of $85M-$90M and EPS of $0.15-$0.19, ahead of the $81.2M and $0.12 consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • STX

    Seagate's (NASDAQ:STX) sharply lower outlook, burdened by spiking commodity costs for certain...

    Seagate's (NASDAQ:STX) sharply lower outlook, burdened by spiking commodity costs for certain materials used in drives, sends shares -14% premarket. “Prices [for rare-earth materials] have increased significantly,” in recent weeks, CFO Patrick O’Malley tells Barron's. “And prices have gotten highly volatile." U.S. debt talks are adding to the caution, CEO Steve Luczo says.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) is up another 10.4% in premarket trading as Bloomberg reports that...

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) is up another 10.4% in premarket trading as Bloomberg reports that not only Google (NASDAQ:GOOG), but also Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is considering a possible bid for the company and its patent portfolio. InterDigital shares are now up 81% since the company announced on Tuesday it would explore a sale of its assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • IDRA

    Idera Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDRA) says the FDA has told it to freeze a planned midstage trial...

    Idera Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDRA) says the FDA has told it to freeze a planned midstage trial to test its IMO-3100 candidate for the treatment of psoriasis. The company hasn't yet received a written notice, which will detail the FDA's reasoning behind the halt. Shares -1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • NYT

    New York Times (NYSE:NYT): Q2 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $576.7M (-2.2% Y/Y). "The...

    New York Times (NYSE:NYT): Q2 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $576.7M (-2.2% Y/Y). "The Company expects operating costs to decline in the low-single digits in the second half of the year, with most of the decline occurring in the fourth quarter". Shares +2.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 3 Comments
  • TZOO

    More on Travelzoo's (NASDAQ:TZOO) Q2 results: Revenues missed consensus by roughly $2.9M. The...

    More on Travelzoo's (NASDAQ:TZOO) Q2 results: Revenues missed consensus by roughly $2.9M. The company partly blames its earnings shortfall on a "television advertising test" that had a $0.07/share impact, and also talks of growing headcount at an unprecedented rate. Shares -21.8% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • FSL

    Freescale Semiconductor (NYSE:FSL) Q2 loss narrows on higher sales of microcontrollers and...

    Freescale Semiconductor (NYSE:FSL) Q2 loss narrows on higher sales of microcontrollers and healthier gross margins, but the company gives a cautious view on Q3. Revenue for the next quarter is now expected to be flat to -3%. Shares -4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK), whose Q2 EPS easily beat consensus, is benefiting from the fact that its...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK), whose Q2 EPS easily beat consensus, is benefiting from the fact that its low-end phones, which haven't lost as much market share, produce higher margins than its smartphones. However, Nokia can't be pleased with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) having passed the company to become the global leader in smartphone shipments. NOK +4.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
  • PLX

    Shares of Protalix (NYSEMKT:PLX) +4.4% premarket after a report says the firm will file a...

    Shares of Protalix (NYSEMKT:PLX) +4.4% premarket after a report says the firm will file a request with the FDA within days for approval of the firm's Gaucher's disease treatment Uplyso.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • TZOO

    Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO): Q2 EPS of $0.30 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $37.6M (+33.7% Y/Y). Shares...

    Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO): Q2 EPS of $0.30 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $37.6M (+33.7% Y/Y). Shares -22% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • RANJF

    Dutch staffing company Randstad Holding NV (OTCPK:RANJF) pays $14 per share in a $709M all-cash...

    Dutch staffing company Randstad Holding NV (OTCPK:RANJF) pays $14 per share in a $709M all-cash offer to acquire SFN Group (NYSE:SFN). The deal will boost the company's presence in the highly fragmented U.S. human-resources- services market. SFN shares +51% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM

  • The summit of EU leaders to move the ball forward on Greece's next bailout begins in Brussels....

    The summit of EU leaders to move the ball forward on Greece's next bailout begins in Brussels. There must be some good news already leaking out, because European shares have bounced sharply in the last 30 minutes. Stoxx 50 flat after being down 1% minutes ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM
